Puts the target to sleep at the end of the next turn.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  If the target leaves the field, this effect is canceled.  If the target has a status effect when this move is used, this move will fail.

If the target is protected by safeguard when this move is used, this move will fail.

insomnia and vital-spirit prevent the sleep if the target has either at the end of the next turn, but will not cause this move to fail on use.

egg.name: Curse
egg.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Tackle
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Confusion
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: Disable
egg.description: Disables the target's last used move, preventing its use for 4–7 turns, selected at random, or until the target leaves the field.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed,  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

egg.name: Headbutt
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Growl
egg.description: Lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

egg.name: Water gun
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Zen headbutt
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Slack off
egg.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.

egg.name: Amnesia
egg.description: Raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.

egg.name: Psychic
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Heal pulse
egg.description: Heals the target for half its max HP.

egg.name: Attract
egg.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Bide
egg.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Blizzard
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

egg.name: Body slam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

egg.name: Brine
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.

egg.name: Bubblebeam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Bulldoze
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Calm mind
egg.description: Raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

egg.name: Captivate
egg.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

egg.name: Dig
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User digs underground for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, earthquake, fissure, and magnitude still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Dive
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User dives underwater for one turn, becoming immune to attack, and hits on the second turn.

During the immune turn, surf, and whirlpool still hit the user normally, and their power is doubled if appropriate.

The user may be hit during its immune turn if under the effect of lock-on, mind-reader, or no-guard.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Double edge
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Double team
egg.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

egg.name: Dream eater
egg.description: Fails if not used on a sleep Pokémon.  Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

egg.name: Earthquake
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dig, this move will hit with double power.

egg.name: Echoed voice
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If any friendly Pokémon used this move earlier this turn or on the previous turn, that use's power is added to this move's power, to a maximum of 200.

egg.name: Endure
egg.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Facade
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

egg.name: Fire blast
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: Fissure
egg.description:
Inflicts damage equal to the target's max HP.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This move's accuracy is 30% plus 1% for each level the user is higher than the target.  If the user is a lower level than the target, this move will fail.

Because this move inflicts a specific and finite amount of damage, endure still prevents the target from fainting.

The effects of lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard still apply, as long as the user is equal or higher level than the target.  However, they will not give this move a chance to break through detect or protect.

egg.name: Flash
egg.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

egg.name: Frustration
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Grass knot
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's weight in kilograms, to a maximum of 120.

Target's weight | Power
--------------- | ----:
Up to 10kg      |    20
Up to 25kg      |    40
Up to 50kg      |    60
Up to 100kg     |    80
Up to 200kg     |   100
Above 200kg     |   120

egg.name: Hail
egg.description:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow-cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.

egg.name: Hidden power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

egg.name: Ice beam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

egg.name: Icy wind
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: Incinerate
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, it's destroyed and cannot be used in response to this move.

egg.name: Iron tail
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to lower the target's Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Light screen
egg.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from special attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

egg.name: Mimic
egg.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

egg.name: Mud slap
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's accuracy by one stage.

egg.name: Natural gift
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

egg.name: Nightmare
egg.description: Only works on sleep Pokémon.  Gives the target a nightmare, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.  If the target wakes up or leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Pay day
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  After the battle ends, the winner receives five times the user's level in extra money for each time this move was used.

egg.name: Protect
egg.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Psych up
egg.description:
Discards the user's stat changes and copies the target's.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Psyshock
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Damage calculation always uses the target's Defense, regardless of this move's damage class.

egg.name: Psywave
egg.description: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.

egg.name: Rage
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

egg.name: Rain dance
egg.description:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar-beam has half power.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift-swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry-skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects-effects, and Pokémon with rain-dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

egg.name: Recycle
egg.description:
User recovers the last item consumed by the user or a Pokémon in its position on the field.  The item must be used again before it can be recovered by this move again.  If the user is holding an item, this move fail.

Items taken or given away by covet, knock-off, switcheroo, thief, or trick may not be recovered.

egg.name: Reflect
egg.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

egg.name: Rest
egg.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

egg.name: Return
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

egg.name: Round
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

egg.name: Scald
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: Secret power
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

egg.name: Shadow ball
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

egg.name: Skill swap
egg.description:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.

egg.name: Skull bash
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Defense by one stage.  User then charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

egg.name: Sleep talk
egg.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

egg.name: Snore
egg.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: Strength
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Substitute
egg.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

egg.name: Sunny day
egg.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

egg.name: Surf
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

egg.name: Swagger
egg.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

egg.name: Swift
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

egg.name: Take down
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

egg.name: Telekinesis
egg.description:
For three turns (including this one), moves used against the target have 100% accuracy, but the target is immune to ground damage.  Accuracy of one-hit KO moves is exempt from this effect.

This effect is removed by gravity.  If Gravity is already in effect, this move will fail.

egg.name: Teleport
egg.description: Does nothing.  Wild battles end immediately.

egg.name: Thunder wave
egg.description: Paralyzes the target.

egg.name: Toxic
egg.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

egg.name: Tri attack
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.  One of these effects is selected at random; they do not each have independent chances to occur.

egg.name: Trick room
egg.description:
For five turns (including this one), slower Pokémon will act before faster Pokémon.  Move priority is not affected.  Using this move when its effect is already active will end the effect.

Pokémon holding full-incense, lagging-tail, or quick-claw and Pokémon with stall ignore this effect.

egg.name: Water pulse
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: Whirlpool
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

egg.name: Zap cannon
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to paralyze the target.

egg.name: After you
egg.description:
The target will act next this turn, regardless of Speed or move priority.
If the target has already acted this turn, this move will fail.

egg.name: Aqua tail
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: Flamethrower
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to burn the target.

egg.name: Magic coat
egg.description:
The first non-damaging move targeting the user this turn that inflicts major status effect-effects, stat change, or trap effects will be reflected at its user.

defog, memento, and teeter-dance are not reflected.

attract, flatter, gastro-acid, leech-seed, swagger, worry-seed, and yawn are reflected.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Signal beam
egg.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: Trick
egg.description:
User and target permanently swap held item.  Works even if one of the Pokémon isn't holding anything.  If either Pokémon is holding mail, this move will fail.

If either Pokémon has multitype or sticky-hold, this move will fail.

If this move results in a Pokémon obtaining choice-band, choice-scarf, or choice-specs, and that Pokémon was the latter of the pair to move this turn, then the move it used this turn becomes its chosen forced move.  This applies even if both Pokémon had a choice item before this move was used.  If the first of the two Pokémon gains a choice item, it may select whatever choice move it wishes next turn.

Neither the user nor the target can recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

egg.name: Belly drum
egg.description: User pays half its max HP to raise its Attack to +6 stages.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

egg.name: Block
egg.description:
The target cannot switch out normally.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.  This effect ends when the user leaves the field.

The target may still escape by using baton-pass, u-turn, or a shed-shell.

Both the user and the target pass on this effect with baton-pass.

egg.name: Future sight
egg.description:
Inflicts typeless regular damage at the end of the third turn, starting with this one.  This move cannot score a critical hit.  If the target switches out, its replacement will be hit instead.  Damage is calculated at the time this move is used; stat changes and switching out during the delay won't change the damage inflicted.  No move with this effect can be used against the same target again until after the end of the third turn.

This effect breaks through wonder-guard.

If the target is protected by protect or detect on the turn this move is used, this move will fail.  However, the damage on the third turn will break through protection.

The damage is applied at the end of the turn, so it ignores endure and focus-sash.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

egg.name: Me first
egg.description:
If the target has selected a damaging move this turn, the user will copy that move and use it against the target, with a 50% increase in power.

If the target moves before the user, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

egg.name: Mud sport
egg.description: electric moves inflict half damage, regardless of target.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: Safeguard
egg.description:
Protects Pokémon on the user's side of the field from major status effects and confusion for five turns.  Does not cancel existing ailments.  This effect remains even if the user leaves the field.

If yawn is used while this move is in effect, it will immediately fail.

defog used by an opponent will end this effect.

This effect does not prevent the confusion caused by outrage, petal-dance, or thrash.

egg.name: Stomp
egg.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

Power is doubled against Pokémon that have used minimize since entering the field.

egg.name: Wonder room
egg.description: For five turns (including this one), every Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense are swapped.

natural.name: Silver wind
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

natural.name: Foresight
natural.description: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Confusion
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Supersonic
natural.description: Confuse the target.

natural.name: Leech life
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

natural.name: Poisonpowder
natural.description: Poisons the target.

natural.name: Disable
natural.description: Disables the target's last used move, preventing its use for 4–7 turns, selected at random, or until the target leaves the field.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed,  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

natural.name: Tackle
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.

natural.name: Stun spore
natural.description: Paralyzes the target.

natural.name: Gust
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

natural.name: Signal beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Psybeam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

natural.name: Zen headbutt
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Sleep powder
natural.description: Puts the target to sleep.

natural.name: Poison fang
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to badly poison the target.

natural.name: Psychic
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Bug buzz
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Quiver dance
natural.description: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.

natural.name: Acrobatics
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

natural.name: Aerial ace
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Attract
natural.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

natural.name: Bide
natural.description:
User waits for two turns.  On the second turn, the user inflicts twice the damage it accumulated on the last Pokémon to hit it.  Damage inflicted is typeless.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Captivate
natural.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.

natural.name: Curse
natural.description:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton-pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move.

natural.name: Defog
natural.description:
Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.  Clears away fog.  Removes the effects of mist, light-screen, reflect, safeguard, spikes, stealth-rock, and toxic-spikes from the target's side of the field.

If the target is protected by mist, it will prevent the evasion change, then be removed by this move.

natural.name: Double edge
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Double team
natural.description: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

natural.name: Endure
natural.description:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Energy ball
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

natural.name: Facade
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: Flash
natural.description: Lowers the target's accuracy by one stage.

natural.name: Frustration
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Giga drain
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

natural.name: Giga impact
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

natural.name: Hidden power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

natural.name: Hyper beam
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

natural.name: Mega drain
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

natural.name: Mimic
natural.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

natural.name: Natural gift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

natural.name: Protect
natural.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Psywave
natural.description: Inflicts typeless damage between 50% and 150% of the user's level, selected at random in increments of 10%.

natural.name: Rage
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Every time the user is hit after it uses this move but before its next action, its Attack raises by one stage.

natural.name: Razor wind
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Reflect
natural.description:
Erects a barrier around the user's side of the field that reduces damage from physical attacks by half for five turns.  In double battles, the reduction is 1/3.  Critical hit are not affected by the barrier.

If the user is holding light-clay, the barrier lasts for eight turns.

brick-break or defog used by an opponent will destroy the barrier.

natural.name: Rest
natural.description:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect-effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early-bird.

This move fail if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital-spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

natural.name: Return
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

natural.name: Roost
natural.description: Heals the user for half its max HP.  If the user is flying, its flying type is ignored until the end of this turn.

natural.name: Round
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

natural.name: Secret power
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to inflict an effect chosen according to the terrain.

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Building       | Paralyze target
Cave           | Makes target flinch
Deep water     | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Desert         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Grass          | Puts target to sleep
Mountain       | Makes target flinch
Road           | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Shallow water  | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Snow           | Freezes target
Tall grass     | Puts target to sleep

In Pokémon Battle Revolution:

Terrain        | Effect
-------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------
Courtyard      | Paralyze target
Crystal        | Makes target flinch
Gateway        | Lowers target's Attack by one stage
Magma          | Makes target flinch
Main Street    | Paralyze target
Neon           | Paralyze target
Stargazer      | Makes target flinch
Sunny Park     | Puts target to sleep
Sunset         | Lowers target's accuracy by one stage
Waterfall      | Puts target to sleep

natural.name: Skill swap
natural.description:
User and target switch abilities.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

If either Pokémon has multitype or wonder-guard, this move will fail.

natural.name: Sleep talk
natural.description:
Only usable if the user is sleep.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus-punch, me-first, metronome, mirror-move, shadow-force, skull-bash, sky-attack, sky-drop, sleep-talk, solar-beam, razor-wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast-burn, frenzy-plant, giga-impact, hydro-cannon, hyper-beam, roar-of-time, or rock-wrecker—and the user is still sleep next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep-talk.

natural.name: Sludge bomb
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

natural.name: Snore
natural.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

natural.name: Solarbeam
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

natural.name: Struggle bug
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

natural.name: Substitute
natural.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

natural.name: Sunny day
natural.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

natural.name: Swagger
natural.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

natural.name: Sweet scent
natural.description: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

natural.name: Swift
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

natural.name: Take down
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

natural.name: Teleport
natural.description: Does nothing.  Wild battles end immediately.

natural.name: Thief
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

natural.name: Toxic
natural.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

natural.name: U turn
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

natural.name: Venoshock
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

natural.name: Whirlwind
natural.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

natural.name: Air cutter
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

natural.name: Bug bite
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

natural.name: Ominous wind
natural.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

natural.name: String shot
natural.description: Lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

natural.name: Tailwind
natural.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

natural.name: Twister
natural.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Silver wind
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

machine.name: Foresight
machine.description: Resets the target's evasion to normal and prevents any further boosting until the target leaves the field.  A ghost under this effect takes normal damage from normal and fighting moves.  This move itself ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Confusion
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Supersonic
machine.description: Confuse the target.

machine.name: Leech life
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

machine.name: Poisonpowder
machine.description: Poisons the target.

machine.name: Disable
machine.description: Disables the target's last used move, preventing its use for 4–7 turns, selected at random, or until the target leaves the field.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed,  if its last used move has 0 PP remaining, or if it already has a move disabled, this move will fail.

machine.name: Tackle
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: Stun spore
machine.description: Paralyzes the target.

machine.name: Gust
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: Signal beam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Psybeam
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

machine.name: Zen headbutt
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Sleep powder
machine.description: Puts the target to sleep.

machine.name: Poison fang
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to badly poison the target.

machine.name: Psychic
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Bug buzz
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: Quiver dance
machine.description: Raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense, and Speed by one stage each.

machine.name: Acrobatics
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user has no held item, this move has double power.

machine.name: Aerial ace
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Attract
machine.description: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: Sludge bomb
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: Snore
machine.description: Only usable if the user is sleep.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: Solarbeam
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  User charges for one turn before attacking.

During sunny-day, the charge turn is skipped.

During hail, rain-dance, or sandstorm, power is halved.

This move cannot be selected by sleep-talk.

machine.name: Struggle bug
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: Substitute
machine.description:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effect-effects, confusion, and flinch.  The effects of smelling-salts and wake-up-slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect-effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap-berry.  magic-coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream-eater, embargo, flatter, gastro-acid, grudge, heal-block, leech-seed, lock-on, mean-look, mimic, mind-reader, nightmare, pain-split, psycho-shift, spider-web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry-seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt-absorb absorbing thunder-wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life-orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic-spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton-pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

machine.name: Sunny day
machine.description:
Changes the weather to sunshine for five turns, during which fire moves inflict 50% extra damage, and water moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding heat-rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

Pokémon cannot become frozen.

thunder has 50% accuracy.

solar-beam skips its charge turn.

moonlight, morning-sun, and synthesis heal 2/3 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with chlorophyll have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become fire.

Pokémon with leaf-guard are not affected by major status effects-effects.

Pokémon with flower-gift change form; every Pokémon on their side of the field have their original Attack and Special Attack increased by 50%.

Pokémon with dry-skin lose 1/8 max HP at the end of each turn.

Pokémon with solar-power have their original Special Attack raised by 50% but lose 1/8 their max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: Swagger
machine.description: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: Sweet scent
machine.description: Lowers the target's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: Swift
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: Take down
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

machine.name: Teleport
machine.description: Does nothing.  Wild battles end immediately.

machine.name: Thief
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding an item and the user is not, the user will permanently take the item.  Damage is still inflicted if an item cannot be taken.

Pokémon with sticky-hold or multitype are immune to the item theft effect.

The target cannot recover its item with recycle.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: Toxic
machine.description: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: U turn
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage, then the user immediately switches out, and the trainer selects a replacement Pokémon from the party.  If the target faint from this attack, the user's trainer selects the new Pokémon to send out first.  If the user is the last Pokémon in its party that can battle, it will not switch out.

The user may be hit by pursuit when it switches out, if it has been targeted and pursuit has not yet been used.

This move may be used even if the user is under the effect of ingrain.  ingrain's effect will end.

machine.name: Venoshock
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: Whirlwind
machine.description:
Switch the target out for another of its trainer's Pokémon selected at random.  Wild battles end immediately.

Doesn't affect Pokémon with suction-cups or under the effect of ingrain.

machine.name: Air cutter
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User's critical hit rate is one level higher when using this move.

machine.name: Bug bite
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is holding a berry, this move has double power, and the user takes the berry and uses it immediately.

If the target is holding a jaboca-berry or rowap-berry, the berry is still removed, but has no effect.

If this move is super effective and the target is holding a berry that can reduce this move's damage, it will do so, and will not be stolen.

machine.name: Ominous wind
machine.description: Inflicts regular damage. Has a 10% chance to raise all of the user's stats one stage.

machine.name: Tailwind
machine.description: For the next three turns, all Pokémon on the user's side of the field have their original Speed doubled.  This effect remains if the user leaves the field.

machine.name: Twister
machine.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make each target flinch.

If the target is under the effect of bounce, fly, or sky-drop, this move will hit with double power.

tutor.name: Hidden power
tutor.description:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IV.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IV.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

tutor.name: Hyper beam
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  User loses its next turn to "recharge", and cannot attack or switch out during that turn.

tutor.name: Mega drain
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Drains half the damage inflicted to heal the user.

tutor.name: Mimic
tutor.description:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror-move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: Natural gift
tutor.description: Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's held berry.  The berry is consumed.  If the user is not holding a berry, this move will fail.

tutor.name: Protect
tutor.description:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick-guard, or wide-guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock-on, mind-reader, and no-guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn-drill, and sheer-cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain-dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom-desire and future-sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish-song
* shadow-force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych-up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.
